name: Jahid Hassan Shamim
bio: I am a Software Engineer Passionate about Database Design and API development and System Design by working in a collaborative environment with a flexible nature of adopting, learning and implementing new things to fulfill the project demands. Have a strong ambition to work in the larger scale projects by following good practices for making systems efficient.

detail: Led backend design and development of a cross-border product sourcing platform, delivering core features like buyer-driven requests, traveler listings, and real-time updates in a modular and maintainable architecture.
Implemented dynamic workflows for cost calculation, location-based trip matching, and automated user onboarding, ensuring data consistency and high performance through optimized models and queries.
Managed infrastructure migration and scaling; built real-time notification systems; and contributed to platform reliability by overseeing deployment and production operations.
Collaborated on existing ERP system projects by preparing backend methods and writing SQL queries to generate reports for monitoring and evaluating sales force activities.

Contributed to 4 mobile projects including a content management app, a book app integrating Google Books API, a PDF reader with note-taking and PDF generation, and a referral system linked to app sharing.

Gained backend development experience by contributing to 2 backend projects, building custom admin dashboards with CMS integration, designing databases, developing APIs, implementing background jobs, and securing endpoints with API keys.
Built a solid foundation in cross-platform app development by learning Flutter, Firebase, and Riverpod as part of the internship program.
Actively contributed to an existing production-grade Flutter project, assisting in feature development and enhancing user interface components.
Worked on a Doctor and Patient portal to support appointment scheduling and chamber management with individual profiling features.
Designed user interfaces and integrated APIs as per functional requirements.
